documentation.text:
@dev Roles are referred to by their bytes32 identifier. 
 @dev These should be exposed in the external API and be unique.

@dev before setting up any user wallet, all buyers/sellers use a single buyer/seller address, which are maintained by Beston.
 @dev the same goes for ownership tracking in DigitalTwin.sol.

devdoc.author: Yining Hu
devdoc.details: contract currently assume one buyer account and one seller account, should develop an additional wallet contract and allow new user registrationTo do: to implement multi-sig, time-based escrowTo do: to add a product existence modifier, and a role modifier

BuyerSendPayment(string).details: Partial payment is sent to the seller, however, can change depending on the agreement

constructor.details: before setting up any user wallet, all buyers/sellers use a single buyer/seller address, which are maintained by Beston.the same goes for ownership tracking in DigitalTwin.sol.

offer(string,uint256).details: should also require tk to be minted on DigitalTwin.sol

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

agentaddr.details: Roles are referred to by their bytes32 identifier. These should be exposed in the external API and be unique.

devdoc.title: EscrowService Contract, forked from https://github.com/AleRapchan/escrow-service

BuyerDeny(string).notice: Buyer can deny the payment upon unsatisfactory verification result or for other reasons.

BuyerSendPayment(string).notice: Buyer can make a deposit to products on offer

SellerRedeem(string).notice: Seller can redeem with verification Achieves the same payment result as BuyerApprove, but requires seller to pay for execution

userdoc.notice: Building a single role access control Escrow Service using OpenZeppelin Escrow and RBAC
